person_130.name: Pierre-SimonLaplace
person_130.description: French mathematician seen as the Newton of France. He met Davy in 1813 and 1820. ForMemRSL.

person_266.name: Georges-Louis Leclerc, Comte deBuffon
person_266.description: French naturalist, mathematician and cosmologist. His Histoire Naturelle, published in 1789, ran to 37 volumes. ForMemRSL.

person_125.name: JamesHutton
person_125.description: Scottish geologist, agriculturalist and chemical manufacturer. His Theory of the Earth (1795) is one of the foundations of modern geology. Davy discussed Hutton's theories in his lectures and visited some of the key geological sites that Hutton used in his work.

place_437.name: Northern Ireland
place_437.description: Northern Ireland consists of six counties to the north-east of the island, not including the Republic of Ireland county, Donegal, to the west.

place_508.name: Land's End
place_508.description: Land's End is a headland on the west coast of Cornwall. It is the most westerly point of mainland England. The underlying rock at Land's End is granite.

place_021.name: Cornwall
place_021.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

place_523.name: Cape Cornwall
place_523.description: Cape Cornwall is a headland north of Land's End.

place_509.name: Lizard Point
place_509.description: The Lizard is a peninsula of the southern coast of Cornwall. It is the most southerly point of the British mainland. The geology of the Lizard is complex: it contains some of Cornwall's oldest (Precambrian) rocks, as well as heavily metamorphosed rocks.

place_1010.name: Mam Tor
place_1010.description: A hill near Castleton in the High Peak of Derbyshire, England.

place_085.name: Derbyshire
place_085.description: Derbyshire is a county in the East Midlands and includes part of the Peak District.

place_456.name: Cader Idris
place_456.description: Cader Idris is a mountain in Merionnydd, near Dolgellau, Wales.

place_047.name: Donegal
place_047.description: Donegal is a town at the mouth of the River Eske, in north-west Ireland.

place_461.name: Anglesey
place_461.description: Anglesey is an island, and county, on the north-west coast of Wales.

place_1011.name: Morton
place_1011.description: A castle located by an artificial loch in the hills above Nithsdale, in Dumfries and Galloway, south-west Scotland.

place_1035.name: Fingal's Cave
place_1035.description: a sea cave on the uninhabited island of Staffa, in the Inner Hebrides of Scotland, known for its natural acoustics.

place_126.name: Giant's Causeway
place_126.description: The Giant's Causeway is an extensive area of columnar basalt in County Antrim, Northern Ireland, formed by an ancient volcanic fissure eruption.

place_479.name: Pleaskin Cliff
place_479.description: Pleaskin Head is a cliff that is part of the Giant's Causeway coastline, Northern Ireland.

place_132.name: Fairhead
place_132.description: Fairhead is a spectacular 5km long, 82m high cliff above the sea at Ballycastle, County Antrim, Northern Ireland. It is a dolerite sill.

place_592.name: Binevenagh
place_592.description: Binevenagh is a large, steep-sided hill in County Londonderry, Northern Ireland.

place_440.name: Darling Downs
place_440.description: The South Downs are a range of chalk hills extending from Hampshire to Sussex.

place_1012.name: Dorset
place_1012.description: A county in southwest England. It’s known for the Jurassic Coast, a long stretch on the English Channel where the cliffs contain many fossils, and rock formations show millions of years of geological history.

place_300.name: Wiltshire
place_300.description: A county in south-western England. The county town is Trowbridge.

place_294.name: Bagshot Heath
place_294.description: An area of wet and dry heath, bog, and unimproved grassland in Surrey, England.

place_320.name: Norfolk
place_320.description: A county in the east of England. The largest settlement is Norwich.

place_1013.name: Cambridgeshire
place_1013.description: A ceremonial county in the East of England and East Anglia.

place_028.name: Berkshire
place_028.description: Berkshire is a county in south-east England.

place_355.name: Rhone River
place_355.description: A major river in France and Switzerland.

place_945.name: River Arveyron
place_945.description: Davy is possibly referring to the rivers Arveyron and Arve: the Arveyron rises just above Chamonix in France and is a tributary of the Arve.

place_241.name: Lake Geneva
place_241.description: Lake Geneva is the largest body of water in Switzerland.

place_453.name: Capel Curig
place_453.description: Capel Curig is a village in Caernarfonshire, in the heart of Snowdonia.

place_451.name: Snowdonia
place_451.description: Snowdonia is a mountainous region of north Wales.

place_790.name: Yr Wyddfa
place_790.description: Also known as Snowdon. The highest mountain peak in Wales.

place_1014.name: Derwentwater
place_1014.description: A lake in the Lake District in North West England, immediately south of Keswick.

place_079.name: Cumberland
place_079.description: Cumberland is a historic county in the far north-west of England.

place_1015.name: Bassenthwaite lake
place_1015.description: A body of water in the Lake District in North West England, near the town of Keswick.

place_1016.name: Lodore falls
place_1016.description: A waterfall in Cumbria, England, close to Derwentwater and downstream from Watendlath.

place_1017.name: Borrowdale
place_1017.description: A valley and civil parish in the English Lake District in Cumberland, England.

place_402.name: Lochleven
place_402.description: Loch Leven is the largest, lowland, freshwater lake in Scotland. Loch Leven trout are red in colour.

place_497.name: Loch Lomond
place_497.description: Loch Lomond is a Scottish fresh water loch which crosses the Highland Boundary Fault.

place_1018.name: Loch Awe
place_1018.description: A large body of freshwater in Argyll and Bute, Scottish Highlands.

place_518.name: Ganges
place_518.description: The Ganges is a river in Asia running through India and Bangladesh. It is part of the third largest river on earth.

place_409.name: Monarch
place_409.description: A rivulet near Cardiganshire, rising under Plynlimon, and running about six miles south-west to the Rheidiol, near Devil's Bridge.

place_1036.name: Ceredigion
place_1036.description: a county in the west of Wales.

place_410.name: Plynlimon
place_410.description: The highest point of the Cambrian Mountains in Wales.

place_563.name: Hafod
place_563.description: Hafod is a district of the city of Swansea, south Wales, and lies within the Landore ward. Hafod is home to the now-closed Hafod Copperworks, founded in 1810.

place_1019.name: Devil's Bridge, Ceredigion
place_1019.description: A village and community in Ceredigion, Wales. Above the River Mynach on the edge of the village is a series of three stacked bridges, constructed hundreds of years apart, from which the village gets its English name.

place_557.name: Tequendama Falls
place_557.description: The Tequendama Falls is a waterfall of the Bogotá River, Colombia.

place_878.name: United States
place_878.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

place_825.name: River Thames
place_825.description: The River Thames, known alternatively in parts as the River Isis, is a river that flows through southern England including London.

place_071.name: London
place_071.description: The capital city of England and the United Kingdom.

place_1020.name: Santa Fe
place_1020.description: New Mexico’s capital, sits in the Sangre de Cristo foothills.

place_1022.name: Bogotá river
place_1022.description: A major river of the Cundinamarca department of Colombia.

place_1023.name: Magdalena River Valley
place_1023.description: A valley in Colombia located within the Colombian Andes. The valley is specifically situated between the Central and Eastern Ranges and crossed by the river of the same name, the Magdalena River.

place_1024.name: Seine River
place_1024.description: A river in northern France. Its drainage basin is in the Paris Basin covering most of northern France.

place_247.name: Alps
place_247.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

place_1395.name: Pacific Ocean
place_1395.description: The largest and deepest of Earth's five oceans.
